review: I had a reasonable idea of the limitations of the Apple TV from reading the reviews.  I decided to pick one up anyway just to replace my composite video cable adapter that was busted.  That cable costs around $40-$50 and I was able to get the Apple TV for $75.  So instead of hooking a cable from my iPad to the TV, I transfer the video/picture/audio to my TV via the Apple TV and the Airplay function.  When I bring up my video on the iPad, a rectangle with a triangle under it shows up.  If you click on that, my Apple TV shows up and I select it.  When I hit play, the video is transferred via the wireless router in my house to the Apple TV and from the Apple TV to my TV.  As a wireless extension to my iPad, Apple TV seems to work well.  That's worth a solid 3 stars.However, the Apple TV has pretensions of being a multimedia player.  At that, it fails miserably unless your primary source of video and music is from iTunes, Netflix, or Hulu+.  Quite a few folks have raved about the Apple TV menu.  The reason it is reasonably clean is due to the lack of options.  You cannot watch any of your own content unless you have purchased it from iTunes or have it reside on your computer iTunes account.  I knew about this limitation before purchasing this box but I was still shocked with the lack of functionality.  One nice feature is the ability to display your Photo Stream from your Apple iCloud account on your TV as a screen saver.  All in all, I give Apple TV perhaps 1/2 a star on the Photo Stream support but nothing else.So if you are looking to extend your iPad/iPhone/iPod to you TV without wires, this is a nice box (though you need to have a wireless network in your house for it to operate).  If you don't need that wireless extension, don't pick up this box unless you are a big iTunes user.

author: Scott

review: I used to love the Apple TV for one reason, early movie releases.  I could buy movies sometimes as much as two weeks earlier than the physical version and while I didn't buy many, I could rent others.With Apple TV you have a very simple device that pretty much plays movies, music, YouTube videos, Netflix, and TV shows.  Yes this is cool and the interface just works but, it is seriously lagging behind other devices in the market.  For instance, my Google TV has Hulu Plus, Netflix, Play Movies, Crackle, Amazon Prime Instant Video, Flixster, Vudu, Amazon MP3, Pandora, slacker, play music, and a whole host of other options as well as the ability to manage my whole entertainment experience.The first problem is obviously, flexibility and other devices with Google TV or Roku boxes have way better options available to them.  The second issue is that Loyalty isn't rewarded with Apple!  You see, Apple feels that their exclusive product is worth more for rentals over shorter periods of time than the competition.  Both Amazon and Google deliver their rentals at lower prices and Amazon actually gives you twice as long to watch the movie.So, I honestly have to say that you should pass up the Apple TV until Apple gets their head out of their sphincter!  Mine is sitting here where I cannot sell it because I have too many movies that I stream with it (About 30) but, I won't give them any more of my money until they start Rewarding Loyalty instead of Taxing It!
